hi and welcome you listening to the x-22

2017 and the title of the episode is
every time this economic indicator

getting more and more economic data in
and we know the corporate media they're
using the stats saying yes unemployment
is low everything looks great the Fed is
telling everyone that looks great even
Trump is out there he's he's saying that
the stock market is up the economy's
doing well unemployment is very low and
he's promising to bring back all these

why he is saying this a little bit later
in this report but let's look at some of
the economic indicators here first we
have existing home sales which are
declining we have new home sales which
are declined which are declining right
now we have for the first time since
January of 2009 housing starts
they dropped for the third month in a
row in May and they completely missed
expectations of a positive 4.1 percent
it was down negative five point five
percent building permits also tumbled in
May and they missed expectations so
we're seeing the housing market
completely implode on itself and this is
the lowest level for overall housing
starts since 2016 so what is going on
here
well we've been receiving really bad
economic data we know a lot of retail
stores are closing corporations laying
off and most of the statistics that the
US government the Fed puts out but
they're completely manipulated and we
know that they said well they raised the
interest rates once again now we need to
understand something they already
started the process of bringing down the
economy all they've done was accelerated
now now remember this period of time in
real estate is supposed to be the best
time in real estate
spring/summer this is when people want
to get into their homes they want to set
up their homes people like the warm
weather there
hours in front of the houses it makes it
much easier to move into a home and they
want to get into the home before school
starts what we're seeing right now is
that the housing market well it's
imploding on itself during the best time
just like we saw the retail industry
implode on itself during the best time
which is the holiday season and this is
just going to get worse because what's
happening right now is the interest
rates have been moving up mortgage
applications have been declining
it pushes individuals completely out of
the market and what we see now is
traffic is drying up and if you look
around the country just go on to Zillow
yes there's still places we are still
going to see real estate booming those
places where they've been booming for
quite a while they'll take a little bit
longer but they're going to be hit very
very hard look back to 2007-2008 and
just look in Miami area where there were
cranes
all over the place there were condos
being built like crazy and it was
booming with speculator like you
speculators like you've never seen
before and then all of a sudden it came
crashing down and it was a lot worse
than almost every other place and we
could see right now this is going to
spread into every single area and it's
just going to get worse actually the New
York Fed they've already adjusted their
second quarter GDP and they started out
at 3% they're down to one point eight
six percent right now and believe me
it's going to go much much lower we also
see the Atlanta Fed right now they have
adjusted their information on the GDP of
their estimates and we see they started
at four then they went down to 3.2 now
they're down to two point eight seven
eight and we can see this is continually
going lower and lower and when we look
at this we see the hard data points well
they are continually declining even the
soft data now is declining at the same
rate so what we're seeing is everything
starting to fall apart very very quickly
now
one thing that we've been looking at and
these are the different economic
indicators and each one tells us a story
well we're heading into a collapse now
every time the Fed tightens and we look
back in time we see that we enter some
type of recession or depression well
they're tightening once again and they
only can drive the interest rates up to
a certain point until everything falls
apart
and we've been looking at the inverted
yield curve now we mentioned this before
and this happened seven times in a row
and every time the yield curve inverted
we went into a recession or depression
so this is a very good indicator to let
us know where we are headed and right
now for those who are not familiar with
the terminology of an inverted yield
curve when we talk about a yield curve
we're typically talking about the spread
between two-year and 10-year US Treasury
bond yields normally long-term rates are
higher than the short-term rates but
when investors get spooked about the
economy
this can reverse just before every
single recession since the 60s the yield
curve has inverted and now we are
getting dangerously close to it
happening again for the first time in a
decade so what we've seen on Thursday is
that the spread between the two-year and
10-year Treasuries dropped to just 79
basis points this is almost the tightest
the yield curve has been since 2007 so
why is an inverted yield curve such a
big event because when bank assets
generate less income than the bank
liabilities the incentive to make new
loans dries up along with the money
supply and when acid bubbles are starved
of that monetary fuel they burst the
severity of the recession depend on the
intensity of the asset bubbles in
existence prior to the inversion what do
we see a couple days ago loan creation
stalling and declining what else could
we say
we saw the credit impulse going negative
in January's at negative one now it's at
negative three
so what's truly alarming is that the
Federal Reserve they see what's
happening
they see what's happening with the yield
curve they see what's happening with the
other economic indicators and what did
they decide to do they decided to raise
their rates they know right now that
this will bring down the economy and
they're not just raising the rates
they're going beyond this they've
declared that they're going to unwind
their four point five trillion dollars
worth of assets that they've accumulated
since the Great Recession I mean this is
going to be a complete and utter
disaster and we could see that Trump
he's playing into this think about this
how difficult would it be to bring down

he can take out his pen he has the power

do you think the deep state the elite
the central bankers will allow this well
let's say JFK tried to create silver

killed President Lincoln had the
greenback printing currency outside of

killed Andrew Jackson actually he
succeeded but they attempted to murder

will try to get rid of him in a split

been controlling the money supply
they've been telling us how great the

well I'm bringing back jobs when the

the money supply you were controlling

course I believed you that if the stock

I was trying to bring back jobs and the

that's why it crashed now Trump could

I promised jobs to come back to the

there's nothing to point to he can turn

back
because you told us the economy was

why isn't it the IMF is out there they
